New Records: Ezequiel Tovar hit his NL-leading 45th double to tie the game.
Charlie Blackmon reached 800 career RBIs and tied with Carlos Gonzalez for fifth in club history with 227 career homers.
Key Match Events: Charlie Blackmon hit a two-run home run in the second inning.
The Rockies scored five runs with two outs in the eighth inning to secure a 10-8 comeback victory.
Ryan McMahon and Michael Toglia hit doubles in the eighth inning to give Colorado its first lead of the day.
Pedro Pagés hit a two-run homer in the eighth inning for the Cardinals.
Ivan Herrera homered 446 feet to center in the fifth inning for the Cardinals.
Post-Match Reflections: Charlie Blackmon expressed mixed emotions about his impending retirement, stating he will cherish the weekend but also feel sad.
Ryan McMahon highlighted the team's goal to avoid a 100-loss season.
Kyle Freeland reflected on his season, expressing satisfaction with his performance after returning from injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Coors Field in Denver.
The Rockies need to take two of three from the Dodgers to avoid 100 losses this season.
Charlie Blackmon's father, Myron, threw out the first pitch on Thursday.
Fireworks themed in Blackmon's honor were planned for Friday, a No. 19 jersey shirt giveaway for Saturday, and an honorary pregame ceremony for Sunday.
